content: chevron baby blanket & throw by chevrons are everywhere and now you can knit either a throw or a baby blanket in a sportweight yarn from the same pattern size baby blanket approx 27 inches wide by 33 inches long throw approx 48 inches wide by 50 inches long gauge 20 stitches and 28 row equals 4 inches in stockinette stitch needles us size 7 4 5mm worked flat i used 40 inch circular needles or size needed to obtain gauge yarn knitpicks brava sport yarn 100% premium acrylic yarn 100g/273 yds per skein for baby blanket color a 2 skeins silver color b 1 skein white abbreviations color c 1 skein cornflower for throw k knit color a 4 skeins tidepool color b 2 skeins peapod p purl color c 2 skeins silver color d 2 skeins cornflower m1l make one left pick up the bar between color e 2 skeins alfalfa two stiches with the left needle from front to back and knit into the back of the stitch tapestry needle m1r make one right pick up the bar between scissors two stitches with the left needle from the back to the front and knit into the front of the stitch cdd center double decrease slip two stitches together as if to knit knit the next stitch pass the 2 slipped stitches over
